intro: Balduina uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and specialized bladder-like structures. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has a short life cycle and is adapted to thrive in saline environments. Balduina uniflora plays a role in its ecosystem by providing habitat for small invertebrates.
